recommendations.title: Actuaries
recommendations.what_they_do: Analyze statistical data, such as mortality, accident, sickness, disability, and retirement rates and construct probability tables to forecast risk and liability for payment of future benefits. May ascertain insurance rates required and cash reserves necessary to ensure payment of future benefits.
on_the_job: Ascertain premium rates required and cash reserves and liabilities necessary to ensure payment of future benefits.
Collaborate with programmers, underwriters, accounts, claims experts, and senior management to help companies develop plans for new lines of business or improvements to existing business.
Analyze statistical information to estimate mortality, accident, sickness, disability, and retirement rates.
knowledges: arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus, or statistics
skills: Basic Skills
reading work related information
thinking about the pros and cons of different ways to solve a problem
People and Technology Systems
thinking about the pros and cons of different options and picking the best one
measuring how well a system is working and how to improve it
Problem Solving
noticing a problem and figuring out the best way to solve it
abilities: choose the right type of math to solve a problem
make general rules or come up with answers from lots of detailed information
technologies: Data base user interface and query software

job_outlook.description: New job opportunities are very likely in the future.

recommendations.title: Atmospheric & Space Scientists
recommendations.what_they_do: Investigate atmospheric phenomena and interpret meteorological data, gathered by surface and air stations, satellites, and radar to prepare reports and forecasts for public and other uses. Includes weather analysts and forecasters whose functions require the detailed knowledge of meteorology.
on_the_job: Develop or use mathematical or computer models for weather forecasting.
Interpret data, reports, maps, photographs, or charts to predict long- or short-range weather conditions, using computer models and knowledge of climate theory, physics, and mathematics.
Conduct meteorological research into the processes or determinants of atmospheric phenomena, weather, or climate.
knowledges: arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus, or statistics
skills: Basic Skills
reading work related information
figuring out how to use new ideas or things
Problem Solving
noticing a problem and figuring out the best way to solve it
People and Technology Systems
thinking about the pros and cons of different options and picking the best one
figuring out how a system should work and how changes in the future will affect it
abilities: listen and understand what people say
make general rules or come up with answers from lots of detailed information
choose the right type of math to solve a problem

job_outlook.description: New job opportunities are very likely in the future.

recommendations.title: Aerospace Engineers
recommendations.what_they_do: Perform engineering duties in designing, constructing, and testing aircraft, missiles, and spacecraft. May conduct basic and applied research to evaluate adaptability of materials and equipment to aircraft design and manufacture. May recommend improvements in testing equipment and techniques.
on_the_job: Formulate mathematical models or other methods of computer analysis to develop, evaluate, or modify design, according to customer engineering requirements.
Plan or conduct experimental, environmental, operational, or stress tests on models or prototypes of aircraft or aerospace systems or equipment.
Formulate conceptual design of aeronautical or aerospace products or systems to meet customer requirements or conform to environmental regulations.
knowledges: arithmetic, algebra, geometry, calculus, or statistics
skills: Basic Skills
thinking about the pros and cons of different ways to solve a problem
reading work related information
